# AWK basics

## print header info


::: {.cell}

```{.bash .cell-code}
awk -F'\t' '{for (i = 1; i <= NF; ++i) print i, $i; exit }' temp1
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
#lets print sth as an example using the print() function#here the argument we give is what we want to print
print(a)

#print a character --> for this we need to add brackets (' or ") around our character
print("hello world")

```
:::
